Content:
It seems strange to me that none of the mechanics who heard and saw the problem with the exhaust knew how to give a solution and also never encountered it.
What happened was that the original rivets came loose,
the ones that hold the black carbon end attached to the exhaust.

I improvisedly reinforced with some rivets, it held for a while and came loose again Like this about two or three times.
Of course this is caused by high vibrations
(the kind that also loosen screws in the license plate and distort it) And if so, then how is this not a common thing?


Have any of you ever seen one? Creative Ideas?
